trans-unit.source: Draws a set of line segments and Bezier curves

seg-source.mrk: Draws a set of line segments and Bezier curves

target.mrk: Draws a set of line segments and Bezier curves

trans-unit.source: Parameters
Handle to a device context.
The 2D array ([x1, y1, type1], [x2, y2, type2], ... [xN, yN, typeN]) that contains the endpoints for

seg-source.mrk: The 2D array ([x1, y1, type1], [x2, y2, type2], ...
[xN, yN, typeN]) that contains the endpoints for

target.mrk: The 2D array ([x1, y1, type1], [x2, y2, type2], ...
[xN, yN, typeN]) that contains the endpoints for

trans-unit.source: each line segment and the endpoints and control points for each Bezier curve, in logical units. In addition,

seg-source.mrk: each line segment and the endpoints and control points for each Bezier curve, in logical units.

target.mrk: each line segment and the endpoints and control points for each Bezier curve, in logical units.

trans-unit.source: the array contains a parameters that specifies how each point is used. The third parameter of the array

seg-source.mrk: the array contains a parameters that specifies how each point is used.
The third parameter of the array

target.mrk: the array contains a parameters that specifies how each point is used.
The third parameter of the array

trans-unit.source: can be one of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: can be one of the following values.

target.mrk: can be one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: $PT_BEZIERTO
$PT_LINETO
$PT_MOVETO
$PT_BEZIERTO or $PT_LINETO type can be combined with the following value that the corresponding point

seg-source.mrk: $PT_BEZIERTO or $PT_LINETO type can be combined with the following value that the corresponding point

target.mrk: $PT_BEZIERTO or $PT_LINETO type can be combined with the following value that the corresponding point

trans-unit.source: is the last point in a figure and the figure is closed.

seg-source.mrk: is the last point in a figure and the figure is closed.

target.mrk: is the last point in a figure and the figure is closed.

trans-unit.source: $PT_CLOSEFIGURE
[optional] The index of array to start drawing at.

seg-source.mrk: The index of array to start drawing at.

target.mrk: The index of array to start drawing at.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The index of array to stop drawing at.

seg-source.mrk: The index of array to stop drawing at.

target.mrk: The index of array to stop drawing at.

trans-unit.source: Return Value
True
False
Remarks
This function can be used in place of consecutive calls to _WinAPI_MoveToEx(), _WinAPI_LineTo(), and _WinAPI_PolyBezierTo()

seg-source.mrk: This function can be used in place of consecutive calls to _WinAPI_MoveToEx(), _WinAPI_LineTo(), and _WinAPI_PolyBezierTo()

target.mrk: This function can be used in place of consecutive calls to _WinAPI_MoveToEx(), _WinAPI_LineTo(), and _WinAPI_PolyBezierTo()

trans-unit.source: functions to draw disjoint figures. The lines and curves are drawn using the current pen and figures are not filled.

seg-source.mrk: The lines and curves are drawn using the current pen and figures are not filled.

target.mrk: The lines and curves are drawn using the current pen and figures are not filled.

trans-unit.source: If there is an active path started by calling _WinAPI_BeginPath(), _WinAPI_PolyDraw() adds to the path.

seg-source.mrk: If there is an active path started by calling _WinAPI_BeginPath(), _WinAPI_PolyDraw() adds to the path.

target.mrk: If there is an active path started by calling _WinAPI_BeginPath(), _WinAPI_PolyDraw() adds to the path.

trans-unit.source: This function updates the current position.

seg-source.mrk: This function updates the current position.

target.mrk: This function updates the current position.
